name: ICA_AROMA
author: FMRIB Analysis Group, University of Oxford
description:
Interface for the ICA_AROMA.py script.
ICA-AROMA (i.e. 'ICA-based Automatic Removal Of Motion Artifacts') concerns a data-driven method to identify and remove motion-related independent components from fMRI data. To that end it exploits a small, but robust set of theoretically motivated features, preventing the need for classifier re-training and therefore providing direct and easy applicability.

inputs.name: Tr
inputs.description: Tr in seconds. if this is not specified the tr will be extracted from the header of the fmri nifti file.

inputs.name: Denoise type
inputs.description: 'nonaggr' or 'aggr' or 'both' or 'no'. Type of denoising strategy:-no: only classification, no denoising-nonaggr (default): non-aggresssive denoising, i.e. partial component regression-aggr: aggressive denoising, i.e. full component regression-both: both aggressive and non-aggressive denoising (two outputs).

inputs.name: Dim
inputs.description: Dimensionality reduction when running melodic (default is automatic estimation).

inputs.name: Feat dir
inputs.description: file or string representing an existing directory. If a feat directory exists and temporal filtering has not been run yet, ica_aroma can use the files in this directory.

inputs.name: Fnirt warp file
inputs.description: File name of the warp-file describing the non-linear registration (e.g. fsl fnirt) of the structural data to mni152 space (.nii.gz).

inputs.name: Mat file
inputs.description: Path/name of the mat-file describing the affine registration (e.g. fsl flirt) of the functional data to structural space (.mat file).

inputs.name: Melodic dir
inputs.description: file or string representing an existing directory. Path to melodic directory if melodic has already been run.

inputs.name: Out dir
inputs.description: file or string representing a directory. Output directory.

output-files.name: Nonaggr denoised file
output-files.description: If generated: non aggressively denoised volume.

output-files.name: Out dir
output-files.description: file or string representing an existing directory. Directory contains (in addition to the denoised files): melodic.ica + classified_motion_components + classification_overview + feature_scores + melodic_ic_mni).
